settings.id_your_single_subtitle: There are many varieties of spiders in North America. All are easily recognizable by four pairs of legs and a large sac-like abdomen. The size of a spider generally ranges from 10 to 20 mm in length. Color varies from brown and gray to black. They typically have well-developed sense of touch or sight.
settings.page_long_description: There are many varieties of spiders in North America. All are easily recognizable by four pairs of legs and a large sac-like abdomen. The size of a spider generally ranges from 10 to 20 mm in length. Color varies from brown and gray to black. They typically have well-developed sense of touch or sight.
settings.side_bar_fact_description:
Scientific Name:

Araneae

Color:
Vary in colour

Weight:
Spiders can weigh up to 175g

Length:
Roughly 3mm to 35mm long

Tail Length:
N/A

Body:
2 body segments instead of 3: a fused head and thorax and an abdomen

Ears:
Spiders donâ€™t have ears but feel vibrations through surfaces

Eyes:
While most spiders have 8 eyes, there are some that have only 6 and some even fewer than 6

Lifespan:
Most spiders live about 2 years, but some are known to live up to 20 years. Female spiders tend to live longer than male

Droppings:
Spider droppings are a combination of digested food and waste products
